name: Soccer Players With an 'H'? Quiz | Soccer | 10 Questions

questions.text: Born in England in 1941, this 'H' player became the first man to score three goals in a World Cup final. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Geoff Hurst.

	Geoffrey Charles Hurst was born on 8th December, 1941, in Ashton-Under-Lyne, England. His hat-trick in the 1966 World Cup final against West Germany was more remarkable by the fact that had Jimmy Greaves not been injured, Hurst would most certainly not have played. England won the game, 4-2.

questions.text: I was born in France, in 1977. I began my professional career with Monaco, but it was at Arsenal where I became renowned for putting the ball in the back of the net. Who am I?
questions.correct: Thierry Henry & Therry Henry & Henry & Thiery Henry
questions.explanation:
Thierry Henry & Therry Henry & Henry & Thiery Henry.

	Thierry Daniel Henry was born on 17th August, 1977, in Paris, France. His career began with Monaco in 1995, where he scored 20 League goals in 110 games. Henry then moved to Italy with Juventus in 1999, and just seven months later, he was on his way to Arsenal. In October, 2005, Henry broke Ian Wright's Arsenal goalscoring record, when he topped 186 goals.

questions.text: This player was born in 1943 in England. His debut for Leeds United came in 1962. He became the first ever players' Player of the Year in 1974. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Norman Hunter.

	Norman 'Bite Yer Legs' Hunter was born on 24th October, 1943 in Tyne and Wear, England. He played most of his career with Leeds United, and also had spells at Bristol City and Barnsley. Hunter played a total of 540 League games for Leeds, and earned 28 England caps.

questions.text: I was born in Wales in 1963. My real first name is Leslie. Although I wasn't a prolific goalscorer, a good number were special when they hit the net. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Mark Hughes.

	Leslie Mark 'Sparky' Hughes was born on 1st November, 1963, in Wrexham, Wales. During his career, he played for Manchester United (twice), Barcelona, Bayern Munich, Chelsea, Southampton, Everton, and Blackburn Rovers. Hughes managed the Welsh national team between 1999-2004, before taking charge of Blackburn Rovers.

questions.text: Born in Spain in 1968, this player was a Real Madrid stalwart throughout the bulk of his career. His last competitive game was in English football with Bolton Wanderers. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Fernando Hierro.

	Fernando Ruiz Hierro was born on 23rd March, 1968, in Velez, Spain. His career began with Valladolid in 1987, before signing with Real Madrid two years later. During his almost 14-year stay with Real, Hierro won La Liga five times, and the Champions League three times. Hierro played for Bolton Wanderers during the 2004-05 season, before hanging up his boots on an illustrious career. Hierro played in 89 games for his country, and scored 29 goals.

questions.text: I was born in England in 1947, and began my career with Blackpool. I was a Liverpool captain in the 1970s. My nickname was 'Crazy Horse'. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Emlyn Hughes.

	Emlyn Walter Hughes was born on 28th August, 1947, in Barrow-in-Furness, England. Hughes began his career with Blackpool in 1967, and signed for Liverpool three years later. Hughes won four League titles, an FA Cup, two UEFA Cups, and two European Cups while at Anfield. Hughes played 62 times for England, and scored one goal. Emlyn Hughes died on 9th November, 2004 of a brain tumour.

questions.text: Born in Colombia in 1966, this goalkeeper was one of the characters of the game. He is most famous for his 'Scorpion Kick' save, while playing for his country against England. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Rene Higuita.

	Jose Rene Higuita Zapata was born on 28th August, 1966, in Medellin, Colombia. His career was often controversial and tarnished, as he had been imprisoned for a part in a drugs kidnapping, in which he was released after seven months without any charge. Higuita also tested positive for a banned substance in 2004. The 'Scorpion Kick' came in a friendly game between England and Colombia, in which England won, 3-2.

questions.text: I was born in England in 1957. My career began with Tottenham Hotspur in 1975. I released a single with Chris Waddle. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Glenn Hoddle.

	Glenn Hoddle was born on 27th October, 1957, in Hayes, England. His Tottenham Hotspur career lasted between 1975-87, in which he won two FA Cups, and the UEFA Cup. Hoddle and Waddle's "Diamond Lights" reached the UK top 20 singles list. Hoddle played for England in the 1982 and 1986 World Cup finals, and also managed his country between 1996-99.

questions.text: Born in Wales in 1975, this player began his career with Luton Town. However, it was in Scotland where he found his goalscoring feet. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
John Hartson.

	John Hartson was born on 5th April, 1975, in Swansea, Wales. During his career, he played for Luton Town, Arsenal, West Ham United, Milton Keynes Dons, Coventry City, and Glasgow Celtic. Hartson also played 50 games for his country, and scored 14 goals.

questions.text: I was born in Germany in 1939. I am most famous for scoring the opening goal in the 1966 World Cup final against England. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Helmut Haller.

	Helmut Haller was born on 21st July, 1939, in Augsburg, Germany. Haller played for Augsburg (twice), Bologna, and Juventus during his career. He also represented his country 33 times, and scored 13 goals. Haller's goal in the 1966 World Cup final came in the 12th minute. West Germany lost the game 4-2 after extra-time.
